titleStmt.title: William Kirkland v. William Billings. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: William Kirkland v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory
In the matter of the application of William Kirkland for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
The Hon Roger S. Greene Judge of said Court:
The complaint of the afore- named complaintant William Kirkland respectfully sets forth:

First That he is restrained of his liberty at the town of Olympia in the County of Thurston in said Territory of Washington in the County Jail of said Thurston County by one William Billings Sheriff of said County and keeper of said jail;

Second: Complainant says that according to his best knowledge and belief he is re- strained of his liberty as aforesaid under and by virtue of a certain pretended warrant of commitment issued by and H.D. Taylor a Justice of the Peace in and for the County of Chehalis in said Territory, being date May 12th AD 1872 for the alleged offense of having on the 8th day of May AD 1872 murdered one Andrew J Campbell a copy of which pretended warrant of commitment is hereto annexed to which complainant asks herein

Third: That said restraint is wholly illegal for the following owing other first: That no complaint was made before said H.D. Taylor Justice as aforesaid charging complainant with the offense of having murdered Andrew J. Campbell as in said pretended warrant of commitment set forth at the time and in the manner in said pretended warrant set forth or at any other time or in any other manner whatever. Second: That no complaint was made before said H.D. Taylor at the time of issuing said pretended warrant before refered to or or at any time prior thereto charging this complainant with any offense of which any District Court in and for said Territory of Washington has by law at the date of said pretended warrant or prior thereto had jurisdiction or any jurisdiction whatever. Third: That at the date of said pretended warrant or prior thereto no complaint had been made before said Justice H.D. Taylor charging this complainant with any offense whatever.

Wherefore complainant prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may be issued in the premises to inquire into the cause of said restraint and of the same be illegal to the end that complainant may be discharged from said restraint and for such other as may seem just in the premises with the oath of this proceeding.
Territory of Washington Thurston County } ss
William Kirkland being duly sworn on his date says that he is the complainant in the foregoing complaint - that he knows the contents thereof and that the same are true as he verily believes.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 20th day of August 1872
E. Marsh Notary Public for W.T.
In the matter of the application of William Kirkland a Writ of Habeas Corpus
